Message.Title: Conveyor limits error
Message.Description: Error for item source , conveyor . The limits are incorrectly specified.

Message.Title: Conveyor data are defined late
Message.Description: Error for item source , conveyor . The ItmSrcCnvDat instruction must be called before the ItmSrcFlush instruction.

Message.Title: Profile not activated
Message.Description: Profile record not ready
Message.Causes: Try to activate recorded profile too early
Message.Actions: Instruction RecordProfile must be called before ActivateProfile

Message.Title: Recorded profile not stored
Message.Description: No valid profile data to store
Message.Causes: Try to store a recorded profile not existing or not activated .
Message.Actions: Instruction ActivateProfile must be called before StoreProfile

Message.Title: Can't use this profile data file
Message.Description: File not found or data not valid
Message.Causes: File not found or data not valid .
Message.Actions: Check file directory and name and profile data.

Message.Title: Too Many Corrections
Message.Description:
Task:
Max 5 correction descriptors are allowed to be connected.
Program Ref.
Message.Actions:
Check number of connected descriptors.
Recovery:

Message.Title: Correction Not Connected
Message.Description:
Task:
Cannot write to correction descriptor.
Program Ref.
Message.Actions:
Check that the current correction descriptor is connected.
Recovery:

Message.Title: No Corrections Connected.
Message.Description:
Task:
Correction unable to be read.
Program Ref.
Message.Actions:
Check if any correction generator is connected.
Recovery:

Message.Title: Servo Tool Open Error.
Message.Description:
Task:
Not possible to open servo gun in motors off state.
Program Ref.
Message.Actions:
Retry after setting motors on.
Recovery:

Message.Title: Servo Tool Close Error.
Message.Description:
Task:
Not possible to close servo gun in motors off state.
Program Ref.
Message.Actions:
Retry after setting motors on.
Recovery:

Message.Title: Servo Tool Calibration Error.
Message.Description:
Task:
Not possible to calibrate servo gun in motors off state.
Program Ref.
Message.Actions:
Retry after setting motors on.
Recovery:

Message.Title: Servo Tool Error.
Message.Description:
Task:
Servo tool does not exist.
Program Ref.
Message.Actions:
Check mechanical unit name.
Recovery:

Message.Title: Servo Tool error.
Message.Description:
Task:
Emergency stop when executing instruction in background task.
Program Ref.
Message.Actions:
Retry after emergency stop reset.
Recovery:

Message.Title: Servo Tool Error.
Message.Description:
Task:
Not possible to close servo gun. The gun is not open.
Program Ref.
Message.Actions:
Retry after opening the gun.
Recovery:

Message.Title: Servo Tool Parameter Error.
Message.Description:
Task:
The parameter PrePos must be a positive value.
Program Ref.
Message.Actions:
Change the parameter value.
Recovery:

Message.Title: Servo Tool Init Error.
Message.Description:
Task:
The position for servo tool is not initialized.
Program Ref.
Message.Actions:
Change the parameter value or perform a tip change calib.
Recovery:

Message.Title: Servo Tool Synchronization Error.
Message.Description:
Task:
The tips for servo tool are not synchronized.
Program Ref.
Message.Actions:
Synchronize via ManServiceCalib or perform a tool change calibration.
Recovery:

Message.Title: Servo Tool Activation Error.
Message.Description:
Task:
Servo tool is not activated.
Program Ref.
Message.Actions:
Use ActUnit to activate.
Recovery:

Message.Title: Servo Tool Error.
Message.Description:
Task:
Not possible to execute instruction in motors off state for servo tool .
Program Ref.
Message.Actions:
Retry after setting motors on.
Recovery:

Message.Title: Servo Tool Error.
Message.Description:
Task:
Not possible to perform a recalibration of the gun .
Program Ref.
Message.Actions:
Retry after checking values.
Recovery:

Message.Title: Servo Tool Error.
Message.Description:
Task:
Not possible to change force. The gun is not closed.
Program Ref.
Message.Actions:
Retry after closing the gun.
Recovery:

Message.Title: Argument Error
Message.Description: The argument Joint must be between 1 and .
Message.Actions: Check and change the value.

Message.Title: Argument Error
Message.Description: The argument Type doesn't correspond to a service value.

Message.Title: Argument Error
Message.Description: The argument Type does not correspond to a service value.

Message.Title: Argument Error
Message.Description: The argument Robot must be between 1 and .
Message.Actions: Check and change the value.

Message.Title: Argument Error
Message.Description: The argument Level doesn't correspond to a service level.

Message.Title: Parameter Error
Message.Description:
Task:
Faulty AxisNo.
Program Ref.
Message.Actions:
Check and change the value.
Press Start to continue.

Message.Title: I/O Error
Message.Description:
Unable to access the I/O signal.
Signal and unit unknown.
Message.Causes: The connection with the I/O module is broken.
Message.Actions: Re-establish the connection with the I/O unit.

Message.Title: Value Error
Message.Description:
Task:
Illegal value of argument for parameter Axis or Strength.
Program Ref.
Message.Actions: Check and change the value.

Message.Title: Value Error
Message.Description:
Task:
Illegal value of argument for parameter Speed Priority Type.
Program Ref.

Message.Title: Parameter Error
Message.Description:
Task:
Argument On or Off missing.
Program Ref.
Message.Actions: Check the RAPID program. One of the switch On or Off must be given.

Message.Title: Parameter Error
Message.Description:
Task:
Argument TuneValue not allowed together with argument Off.
Program Ref.
Message.Actions: Check and change the RAPID program.

Message.Title: Parameter Error
Message.Description:
Task:
This TuneType is only valid for option Advanced Shape Tuning.
Program Ref.
Message.Actions: Change TuneType or install option.

Message.Description:
Task:
Symbol is read-only.

Task:

Message.Description:
Task:
Search error for symbol .

Task:

Task:

Task:

Message.Title: System Access Error
Message.Description:
Task:
Cannot convert date.
Program Ref.
Message.Actions: Warm start and retry.

Message.Title: Parameter Error
Message.Description:
Task:
must be num, bool or string.
Program Ref.
Message.Actions: Check and change the RAPID program.

Message.Title: Parameter Error
Message.Description:
Task:
The argument type of is not compatible with cfg type. Expected .
Program Ref.
Message.Actions: Recovery:

Message.Description:
Task:
Unknown cfg domain in argument .
Program Ref.

Check and change the RAPID program.
Recovery:

Message.Description:
Task:
Unknown cfg type in argument .
Program Ref.
Message.Actions:

Recovery:

Task:
Unknown cfg instance in argument .

Task:
The path '' in argument is incorrect.

Message.Title: I/O Error
Message.Description: Unable to access the I/O signal. Signal and unit unknown.
Message.Causes: The connection with the I/O module is broken.
Message.Actions: Re-establish the connection with the I/O unit. To make it possible to restart the program move PP to a safe restart position.

Message.Title: Argument Error
Message.Description:
Task :
The delaytime has to be positive.
Program Ref.
Message.Actions: Change the value of delaytime.

Message.Title: Axis Error
Message.Description:
Task:
The single axis is not init correctly. The sensor is not activated.
Program Ref.

Message.Title: Axis Error
Message.Description:
Task:
The single axis is not init correctly.
The sensor process is not init correctly.
Program Ref.

Message.Title: Argument Error
Message.Description:
Task:
Orientation definition error in .
Program Ref.
Message.Actions:
Check orientation.
All used orientations must be normalized i.e. the sum of the quaternion elements squares must equal 1.

Message.Title: System Access Error
Message.Description:
Task:
Unknown LOGSRV instance.
Program Ref.
Message.Actions: Warm start and retry.

Message.Title: System Access Error
Message.Description:
Task:
Cannot set test signals.
Program Ref.
Message.Actions: Warm start and retry.

Message.Title: Parameter Error
Message.Description:
Task:
Unknown mechanical unit.
Program Ref.
Message.Actions:
Check if the mechanical unit exists in the system.
Recovery:

Message.Title: Parameter Error
Message.Description:
Task:
Argument Axis is out of range.
Program Ref.
Message.Actions:
Check and change the value of the argument axis.
Recovery:

Message.Title: Parameter Error
Message.Description:
Task:
Argument Channel is out of range.
Program Ref.
Message.Actions: Check and change the value of argument Channel.

Message.Title: System Access Error
Message.Description:
Task:
Cannot reset all test signals.
Program Ref.
Message.Actions: Warm start and retry.

Message.Title: Undefined Load
Message.Description:
Task:
WARNING!
Argument has undefined load (mass=0).
Program Ref.
Message.Consequences: IMPORTANT TO DEFINE CORRECT LOAD to avoid mechanical damages of the robot.
Message.Actions: Define the actual load for the tool or the grip load before program movement or jogging. A good motion performance requires a correctly defined load.

Message.Title: Undefined Load
Message.Description:
Task:
WARNING!
Argument has undefined load center of gravity.
Program Ref.
Message.Consequences: IMPORTANT TO DEFINE CORRECT LOAD to avoid mechanical damage of the robot.
Message.Actions:
Define the actual center of gravity for the tool load or the grip load before program movement or jogging (cog.x, cog.y and cog.z cannot be 0 mm at the same time). Load identification can be done with the service routine
LoadIdentify.

Message.Title: Argument Is Missing
Message.Description:
Task:
One of the switch parameter or has to be defined.
Program Ref.
Message.Consequences: The called RAPID routine could not be executed.
Message.Actions: An argument of the data type switch must be specified.

Message.Title: UnLoad Error
Message.Description:
Task:
Module loaded with path is active and therefore cannot be erased.
Program Ref.
Message.Causes:
Instruction UnLoad or WaitLoad is executed in the same module as the module that should be removed.
Instruction UnLoad or WaitLoad is in a trap that is executed earlier then expected.
If there is a CONNECT to a trap routine in the module, an IDelete on the trap has to be done before the module can be unloaded.
Message.Actions:
Check that the module does not contain routines or data that are still active, for example CONNECT.
Recovery:

Message.Title: Reference Error
Message.Description:
Task:
The reference in argument is not an entire persistent variable.
Program Ref.
Message.Actions:
It is not possible to use record component or array element in arg. .
It is only possible to use entire persistent variables for Tool, WObj or Load
in any motion instruction.

Message.Title: Argument Error
Message.Description:
Task:
Argument Tool has negative load of the tool.
Program Ref.
Message.Actions:
Define the correct load of the tool before use of the tool for jogging or program movement. Load identification of the tool can be done with the service
routine LoadIdentify.

Message.Title: Argument Error
Message.Description:
Task:
Argument Tool has at least one inertia data component with negative value.
Program Ref.
Message.Actions: Define all inertia data components (ix, iy or iz) to actual positive values.

Message.Title: Argument Error
Message.Description:
Task:
No \WObj specified for movement with stationary TCP.
Program Ref.
Message.Actions:
Add argument \WObj for actual work object.
If not movement with stationary TCP, change the component "robhold" in argument Tool to TRUE (robot holds the tool).

Message.Title: Argument Error
Message.Description:
Task:
It is undefined if the robot holds the tool or the work object.
Program Ref.
Message.Consequences: The program execution is immediately stopped.
Message.Causes: Mismatch of component robhold in the tool and the work object.
Message.Actions: Check if mismatch between argument Tool and argument \WObj for data component robhold.

Message.Title: Argument Error
Message.Description:
Task:
Argument has at least one data component with negative value.
Program Ref.
Message.Actions: Set all data components in argument to positive values.

Message.Title: Argument Error
Message.Description:
Task:
Argument may not have a negative value.
Program Ref.
Message.Actions: Set argument to a positive value.

Message.Title: Value Error
Message.Description:
Task:
Illegal value in argument .
Program Ref.
Message.Actions: Check the RAPID program.

Message.Title: Argument Error
Message.Description:
Task:
Argument \WObj specifies a mechanical unit name, which is not activated
or is unknown in the system.
Program Ref.
Message.Actions: The mechanical unit name defined in \WObj must correspond to the name earlier defined in the system parameters and must be activated.

Message.Title: Argument Error
Message.Description:
Task:
Argument contains an illegal interrupt number.
Program Ref.
Message.Causes: Input interrupt number is illegal because it has not been allocated by the instruction CONNECT.
Message.Actions: Use the instruction CONNECT to allocate and connect an interrupt number to a trap routine.

Message.Title: Argument Error
Message.Description:
Task:
Argument contains an interrupt number, which is already in use for other purposes.
Program Ref.
Message.Actions: Before reuse of an interrupt variable in the program, it must have been cancelled with the instruction IDelete.

Message.Title: Type Error
Message.Description:
Task:
Illegal data type of argument .
Program Ref.
Message.Actions: Check the RAPID program.

Message.Title: Reference Error
Message.Description:
Task:
Trigg parameter number , reference to undefined trigg data.
Program Ref.
Message.Actions: Define trigg data by executing instruction TriggIO, TriggInt, TriggEquip, TriggSpeed or TriggCheckIO before execution of instruction TriggL, TriggC, TriggJ, CapL or CapC.

Message.Title: System Access Error
Message.Description:
Task:
Operative system get time failed.
Program Ref.
Message.Actions: Warm start and retry.

Message.Title: Argument Error
Message.Description:
Task:
Argument not within range.
Program Ref.
Message.Actions: The argument must be in range

Message.Title: Argument Error
Message.Description:
Task:
Missing optional argument.
Program Ref.
Message.Actions: Add one of the optional arguments or .

Message.Title: Argument Error
Message.Description:
Task:
Argument or not within range.
Program Ref.
Message.Actions: Check and change the value of the argument.

Message.Title: Argument Error
Message.Description:
Task:
Argument not within range.
Program Ref.
Message.Actions: Check and change the value of the argument.

Message.Title: Argument Error
Message.Description:
Task:
Argument or or not within range.
Program Ref.
Message.Actions: Check and change the argument.

Message.Title: Value Error
Message.Description:
Task:
Illegal value of argument .
Program Ref.
Message.Actions: The index must be an integer and in range 1 to 1024.

Message.Title: Value Error
Message.Description:
Task:
Illegal value of argument for parameter .
Program Ref.
Message.Actions: The value must be an integer and in the correct range.

Message.Title: Argument Switch Is Missing.
Message.Description:
Task:
There is an argument missing.
Program Ref.
Message.Actions: One of the switch parameters \Hex1, \Long4, \Float4 or \ASCII has to be defined.

Message.Title: Index To High.
Message.Description:
Task:
Illegal value in argument .
Program Ref.
Message.Actions: Check the RAPID program.

Message.Title: The String Is Empty.
Message.Description:
Task:
Illegal value in argument .
Program Ref.
Message.Actions: Check the argument, and use a non-empty string.

Message.Title: The Variables Are Equal.
Message.Description:
Task:
The argument FromRawData and ToRawData are equal.
Program Ref.
Message.Actions: Check and change the RAPID program.

Message.Title: Value Error
Message.Description:
Task:
Illegal value in argument .
Program Ref.
Message.Actions: Check and change the value. It must be an integer and in range 0 to 255.

Message.Title: Value Error
Message.Description:
Task:
Illegal value in argument .
Program Ref.
Message.Actions: Check and change the value. NoOfBytes must be an integer and in range 1 to 1024, and not higher than RawData length.

Message.Title: Value Error
Message.Description:
Task:
Illegal value in argument .
Program Ref.
Message.Actions: Check the value. NoOfBytes must not be higher than RawData length.

Message.Title: Argument Error
Message.Description:
Task:
Argument or not within range.
Program Ref.
Message.Actions: Check and change the value of the argument.

Message.Title: Instruction Error
Message.Description:
Task:
You are not allowed to disable unit .
Program Ref.
Message.Actions: Recovery:

Message.Title: Instruction Error
Message.Description:
Task:
There is no client e.g. a teach pendant taking care of instruction.
Program Ref.
Message.Actions: Recovery:

Message.Title: System Access Error
Message.Description:
It was not possible to send data using SCWrite to external computer.
Failed to send variable

Message.Title: Value Error
Message.Description:
Task:
Illegal value in argument .
Program Ref.
Message.Actions:
Check the value:
must be a positive integer.

Message.Title: Wrong size of tasklist
Message.Description:
Task:
The tasklist has wrong number of elements. It must not have less than 1 or more than .
Program Ref.
Message.Actions: Check and change the number of arguments in the tasklist.

Message.Title: Non-consistent task list
Message.Description:
Task:
in the tasklist is not one of the tasks that are configured in the system (max tasks can be configured).
Program Ref.
Message.Actions: Add the task to the system (in Controller configuration) or remove it from the tasklist.
